section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Poultry (Slaughtering for Export) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Adulterated
def.leadIn: adulterated (經攙雜) in relation to a carcass or poultry product means that a substance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been mixed with, added to, placed upon or removed from; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has in any manner contaminated,

def.continued: the carcass or poultry product so as to—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: increase it in bulk or apparent size or otherwise give it a deceptive appearance; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: render it unfit for human consumption; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: injuriously affect its quality, flavour, substance or nature;

section.def: air transhipment cargo (航空轉運貨物) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60); (29 of 2000 s. 6)
air transit cargo (航空過境貨物) means any article in transit that is both imported and consigned for export in an aircraft; (29 of 2000 s. 6)

appropriate authority (適當主管當局) means a person, government department or other body or organization, of a country specified in the First Schedule, appearing to the Director to have administrative control over, or responsibility for, regulating the importation of carcasses and poultry products into the country so specified;
article in transit (過境物品) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60); (29 of 2000 s. 6)
cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport (機場貨物轉運區) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60); (29 of 2000 s. 6)
condemned (宣告不合格、被宣告不合格) in relation to any poultry, carcass or poultry product, means condemned by an inspector under these regulations;

equipment (設備) includes all machinery, plant, tools, utensils, implements, conveyor systems, carts, trolleys, trucks, instruments, bins, containers, electrical and gas fittings, taps, faucets, drains, pipes, tanks, cisterns, basins, latrines, urinals, furnishings and other equipment of any kind in a poultry export factory;
export certificate (出口證明書) means an export certificate or any copy thereof issued by an inspector under regulation 110;
food (食物) means food for human consumption;

def.name: PackingMaterial
def.leadIn: packing material (包裝物料) includes all material used—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to pack or wrap carcasses or poultry products; or

paragraph.name: b

def.name: PoultryExportFactory
def.leadIn: poultry export factory (家禽出口工廠) means a place used or intended to be used for any or all of the following purposes, namely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the slaughter of poultry the carcasses or products of which are intended for export to a country specified in the First Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inspection or processing of carcasses or poultry products intended for export to such a country;

section.def: poultry product (家禽產品) means food prepared from edible parts of poultry in combination with other edible substances;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all buildings which are part of a poultry export factory; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all loading bays or other places where carcasses or poultry products are loaded into vehicles for removal from a poultry export factory;

def.name: Process
def.leadIn: process (加工處理) includes any act, other than cooking, done in the preparation, preservation or packing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a carcass; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a poultry product,

def.continued: which is intended for human consumption;

def.name: Unwholesome
def.leadIn: unwholesome (不衞生) in relation to a carcass or poultry products means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unsound, injurious to health or otherwise rendered unfit for food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: filthy, putrid or decomposed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: processed or stored under insanitary conditions so that the carcass or poultry product may become contaminated with filth or be rendered injurious to health; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: packaged in a container, wrapper or can composed of or containing any poisonous or deleterious substance which may render the carcass or poultry product injurious to human health.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Control of export of carcasses and poultry products to specified countries

subsection.leadIn: No person shall export, attempt to export or permit the export of, any carcasses or poultry products to a country specified in the First Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the carcasses are of poultry slaughtered in a poultry export factory in accordance with these regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the poultry used in the preparation of the poultry products has been so slaughtered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the carcasses or poultry products, as the case may be, have been processed and inspected in a poultry export factory in accordance with these regulations; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: at the time when he exports or attempts to export the carcasses or poultry products there exists an export certificate in respect of such carcasses or poultry products.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: slaughter poultry the carcasses or products of which he knows are intended to be exported to a country specified in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: process carcasses or poultry products which he knows are intended to be so exported,

subsection.continued: other than in a poultry export factory in accordance with these regulations.

subsection.content: This regulation shall not apply to carcasses imported from, or to poultry products derived from carcasses imported from, a country specified in the First Schedule. (L.N. 226 of 1974)

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Application to air transit or air transhipment cargo

subsection.content: Regulation 3(1) does not apply in relation to a carcass or poultry product that is air transit cargo or air transhipment cargo; but if at any time between its being brought into and taken out of Hong Kong such carcass or poultry product is removed from the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport, regulation 3(1) has effect as if this paragraph had not been enacted.

Nothing in this regulation precludes the issue of a certificate under regulation 110 for the export of a carcass or poultry product that is air transit cargo or air transhipment cargo only because the carcass or poultry product has been removed from the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings against a person for an offence under regulation 117(2) for a contravention of regulation 3(1), being proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the export of a carcass or poultry product that is air transit cargo or air transhipment cargo; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in which it is necessary for the prosecution to prove that, at any time between its being brought into and taken out of Hong Kong, the carcass or poultry product was removed from the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport,

subsection.continued: it is a defence for the person to show that he reasonably believed that such removal had not occurred.

subsection.leadIn: Where in any proceedings the defence provided by paragraph (3) involves an allegation that the commission of the offence was due to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act or default of another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reliance on information given by another person,

subsection.continued: the defendant is not, without the leave of the court, entitled to rely on the defence unless, not less than 10 days before the hearing of the proceedings, he has served a notice in writing on the prosecutor giving all particulars of—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the person who committed the act or default or gave the information; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the act, default or information,

subsection.continued: of which he is aware at the time he serves the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not entitled to rely on the defence provided by paragraph (3) by reason of his reliance on information supplied by another person, unless he shows that it was reasonable in all the circumstances for him to have relied on the information, having regard in particular to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the steps which he took, and those which might reasonably have been taken, for the purpose of verifying the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether he had any reason to disbelieve the information.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Prohibition of use of premises as poultry export factory
section.content: No person shall use or permit the use of any premises as a poultry export factory unless there is in force in respect of such premises a licence.

subsection.content: The Director may, subject to these regulations, grant a licence in respect of the premises referred to in the licence for use as a poultry export factory and may attach to the licence such conditions as he may see fit to impose.
A licence shall be in the form prescribed in the Second Schedule and shall not be transferable.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall not grant a licence unless he is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the site of such premises is suitable for the establishment and maintenance thereon of a poultry export factory, having regard to all the circumstances and in particular to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the present use of land or premises near the site;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the availability of satisfactory electricity and potable water supplies and of a hygienic sewage disposal system capable of adequately serving the proposed poultry export factory; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the requirements of these regulations and of any other enactment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has obtained all permits, approvals, consents and licences required under any enactment or Government lease in connexion with the construction, reconstruction, alteration, adaptation and the use of the premises as the case may be, as a poultry export factory; (29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises if constructed, reconstructed, altered or adapted in accordance with any specifications, plans and diagrams delivered to him under paragraph (1) of regulation 6 and approved by him, will comply with these regulations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the premises—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are suitable for use as a poultry export factory;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: are clean and in a good state of repair; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: have not been constructed, reconstructed, altered, adapted or equipped otherwise than in accordance with these regulations and any specifications, plans and diagrams delivered to and approved by the Director in connexion with the application for the licence;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the equipment in the premises is in a good state of repair and in proper working order; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to be granted the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A licence shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: clearly identify the premises in respect of which it relates;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: bear the full name of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remain in force until it is surrendered or revoked.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a licence shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by delivering to the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an application in writing in such form as the Director may require; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such specifications, plans and diagrams of the proposed poultry export factory and the equipment to be installed therein as the Director may require; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by payment to the Director of a fee of three hundred dollars for the inspection of premises on the application for a licence.

subsection.content: Every document delivered by the applicant to the Director under this regulation or pursuant to any requirements of the Director under these regulations shall be certified under the hand of the applicant as true and accurate.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2) the Director may revoke a licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the premises in respect of which the licence is granted are reconstructed, altered or adapted without the consent in writing of the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the grant of the licence has to any material extent been induced by a misrepresentation, whether fraudulent or innocent, made to the Director by or on behalf of the applicant for the licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant failed to disclose to the Director any material fact relevant to the granting of the licence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of which the Director was not aware when the licence was granted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which, if it had been disclosed to the Director before the licence was granted might have caused the Director to withhold the grant of the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the event of a contravention of these regulations or of the conditions of the licence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the licensee; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the occurrence of which the licensee was, in the opinion of the Director, either wholly or partly responsible;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the event of the failure of the licensee to comply with any direction or requirement of the Director or an inspector under these regulations;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if the licensee or, where the licensee is a corporation or firm, any director of the corporation or partner of the firm is convicted of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence triable on indictment which in the opinion of the Director renders the licensee unfit and not a proper person to continue to hold a licence;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an offence under these regulations; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an offence under any other enactment in relation to the slaughter of poultry, or the processing, handling or storage of carcasses or poultry products.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall not revoke a licence under paragraph (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has first called upon the licensee to show cause within such reasonable period of time as the Director may allow, as to why the licence should not be revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee either fails within the time allowed to show cause or shows cause which, in the opinion of the Director, is inadequate.

subsection.content: Upon the revocation of a licence under this regulation, the Director shall immediately cause to be served upon the licensee, either personally or by registered post, a notice in writing specifying the general grounds for the revocation.
Failure to comply with paragraph (3) shall not affect the validity of the revocation of the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee may surrender any licence granted to him by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: giving notice to the Director in writing of the proposed surrender; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivering to the Director the licence which is to be surrendered.

subsection.content: A notice referred to in subparagraph (a) of paragraph (1) may specify the date when the surrender of the licence is to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), the surrender of a licence shall take effect either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the date specified in the notice, being a date not earlier than the date of receipt of the notice by the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such date is so specified, then upon receipt of the notice by the Director.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding paragraph (3), the surrender of a licence shall not take effect until after the licensee has delivered the licence to the Director.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Director to notify appropriate authorities of the revocation or surrender of licence to use premises as a poultry export factory
section.leadIn: Upon the revocation or surrender of a licence the Director shall promptly notify the appropriate authority in each of the countries specified in the First Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of such revocation or surrender;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in case of revocation of a licence, of the reason for the revocation and the date thereof;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in case of surrender of a licence, of the date when the surrender took effect.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Licensee leaving Hong Kong to notify Director

subsection.leadIn: A licensee intending to leave Hong Kong shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before so leaving inform the Director in writing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the date when he intends to leave; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to whether or not he intends to return to Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he intends to return to Hong Kong and if so required by the Director, appoint a deputy willing to act on his behalf, who has authority to act on behalf of the licensee in respect of all matters relating to the poultry export factory of the licensee for so long as the licensee is absent from Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 7, if a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: leaves Hong Kong having informed the Director in writing that he does not intend to return to Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is absent from Hong Kong for more than six consecutive months,

subsection.continued: the Director may revoke the licence granted to the licensee.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Removal of carcasses and poultry products already in premises on grant of licence
section.leadIn: If at the time of the grant of a licence the premises in respect of which the licence is granted already contain carcasses or poultry products such carcasses or poultry products—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be removed from the premises under the supervision of an inspector before the inspection and slaughter of poultry is commenced under these regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be represented or dealt with as having been inspected under these regulations.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Situation and screening of premises
section.leadIn: The premises shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: separate and distinct from any other premises or place habitually used for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the slaughter of animals or poultry; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the preparation for human consumption of the carcasses of animals or poultry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: constructed and properly screened to the satisfaction of the Director, so as to prevent, so far as practicable, the entry of rats, mice and other vermin and the entry of flies and other insects.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Doors
section.content: All doors shall be close fitting and equipped with effective self-closing devices so as to prevent, so far as practicable, the entry of rats, mice and other vermin.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Provision of separate rooms and compartments

subsection.leadIn: Rooms or compartments where poultry is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: held before slaughter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: slaughtered; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: plucked,

subsection.continued: shall be separate and distinct from other rooms or compartments in the premises where other stages in the processing of carcasses or poultry products are carried out, or where carcasses or poultry products are inspected or stored.

subsection.content: Such separate rooms and compartments shall be provided in the premises as, in the opinion of the Director, may be required for the processing of poultry in a hygienic manner.

subsection.leadIn: Provision shall be made to the satisfaction of the Director, for the storage of accumulated refuse until disposal either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in a separate refuse room which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is properly ventilated;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has tightly fitting doors; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is provided with proper drainage and facilities for washing down; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: outside the premises, in a properly constructed hygienic bin or container of adequate size, situated at such distance from the premises as may be necessary to ensure that there is no risk of contamination of any part of the premises or of the carcasses or any poultry product therein.

subsection.leadIn: A refuse room shall have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a floor which is impervious to moisture;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: walls which are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: impervious to moisture up to a height of 1.8 metres; and (L.N. 60 of 1981)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resistant to moisture above that height; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a ceiling which is resistant to moisture.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Separate room or compartment to be provided for carcasses held for further inspection
section.leadIn: A separate room or compartment shall be provided which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of sufficient size to hold all carcasses which for any reason may be required to be held pending further post-mortem inspection in accordance with regulation 86;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so equipped that it may be securely locked; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: located as the Director may require.

subsection.leadIn: Coolers and freezers shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of such construction, design, size and capacity as to enable regulations 92 and 97 to be complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: equipped with floor racks, pallets or other means of ensuring to the satisfaction of the Director that carcasses or poultry products stored therein will be maintained in a wholesome condition.

subsection.content: Freezing rooms shall have forced air circulation.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Incinerator to be provided
section.content: An efficient incinerator, situated at such distance from the premises as the Director may require, shall be provided for the disposal of refuse, and of carcasses and poultry products condemned by an inspector.

subsection.content: The premises and the equipment therein shall be maintained by the licensee in a good state of repair and in a clean and hygienic condition.
The storage and supply rooms and the equipment therein shall be kept dry.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Situation of boiler
section.content: If a boiler is installed in the premises, it shall be so placed that dirt and objectionable odours or fumes from it cannot enter any part of the premises where carcasses or poultry products are processed, inspected, handled or stored.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Accommodation and facilities for inspectors
section.leadIn: The licensee shall provide in the premises, without charge, and to the satisfaction of the Director—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: washing facilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sanitary conveniences; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: cupboards or lockers for clothing,

section.continued: for use by the Director, inspectors and other public officers when performing their duties or exercising their powers under the Ordinance.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Bathrooms, shower rooms and toilets
section.leadIn: Every bath or shower room and all toilet accommodation which opens directly into rooms where carcasses or poultry products are exposed shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fitted with self-closing doors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequately ventilated to the outside of the premises only.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Eating of food
section.content: No person shall eat food in any part of the premises where poultry is inspected, processed, handled or stored.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Construction and finishing of floors, walls, etc.
section.leadIn: In any room where carcasses or poultry products are inspected, processed, handled or stored—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the floor shall be so constructed or finished that it is impervious to moisture and may be easily and thoroughly cleaned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the walls, partitions, doors and posts shall be smooth and constructed of materials which are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: impervious to moisture up to a height of 1.8 metres above the floor; and (L.N. 60 of 1981)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resistant to moisture above that height; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the ceilings shall be moisture resistant, and so finished and sealed as to prevent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: penetration by; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the accumulation thereon of,

paragraph.continued: dust and dirt from any source.

subsection.content: There shall be an efficient drainage and plumbing system for the premises and, so far as may be necessary, for the equipment.
Such drains, pipes, gutters, traps and vents shall be installed and fitted as the Director may, in respect of any particular premises or equipment, require.

The drainage and plumbing systems shall be so constructed and maintained as to provide quick run-off for all water from the premises and equipment, and of all surface water in and around the premises.
Provision shall be made for the disposal of all surface water and waste water so that it will not create a nuisance or hazard to health.

subsection.leadIn: The sewage system shall have sufficient fall and capacity to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry away efficiently all waste from processing operations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent, so far as possible, blockage or over-load of the system.

subsection.leadIn: Traps in the sewage system—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall not be located near any part of the premises where carcasses or poultry products are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: inspected, processed, handled or stored; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: loaded into vehicles for removal from the poultry export factory;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be fitted with covers; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be so constructed that they may be readily cleaned out.

subsection.leadIn: In areas of the premises which are required to be washed down frequently, every floor drain shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: equipped with a deep seal trap; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so installed that effluent cannot back up and flood the floor.

subsection.leadIn: Floor drains in areas of the premises which do not require to be washed down at frequent intervals, need not be equipped with deep seal traps if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the traps are unnecessary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the floor drains are connected to a secondary drainage system which in turn discharges into a properly trapped and vented expansion chamber in such manner that if any back up occurs no effluent will enter the premises.

subsection.leadIn: Drainage from latrines and urinals—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be by means of separate soil pipes until the effluent passes outside the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not discharge into a grease trap; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not enter the sewer lines at a point where there is a possibility of the effluent backing up and flooding the floor of the premises.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Potable water supply to be provided

subsection.leadIn: The premises shall be provided throughout with an ample piped supply of fresh clean potable water which shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivered throughout the premises under adequate pressure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: protected against pollution.

subsection.content: The licensee shall, whenever so directed by the Director, provide such evidence as may be necessary to satisfy the Director of the potability and purity of the water supply in the premises.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Hot water supply
section.leadIn: In every place where it is necessary for the proper cleaning of the premises and equipment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an adequate supply of hot water; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hot water hose connexions,

section.continued: shall be provided to the satisfaction of the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Toilet accommodation shall be provided which is equipped with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lavatory basins and urinals to a standard and of a number not less than that required in respect of industrial undertakings by the Building (Standards of Sanitary Fitments, Plumbing, Drainage Works and Latrines) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. I); (E.R. 3 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an adequate number of washbasins with an ample and constant supply of hot and cold water; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: metal containers for the reception of used towels and other waste.

subsection.content: The licensee shall provide and maintain an adequate supply of hand towels and soap in the toilet accommodation.
Facilities for cleaning utensils and washing hands shall be provided at such places in the premises as the Director may require.
Durable signs written in Chinese characters, requiring employees to wash their hands before returning to work, shall be posted and maintained in a conspicuous place in all toilet accommodation.
The licensee shall keep toilet accommodation and the lavatory basins, urinals, washbasins and other sanitary equipment in the premises clean and in good repair and working order.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Storage of clothing and facilities for employees to change clothing

subsection.leadIn: Adequate facilities shall be provided in the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the storage of overalls, aprons and other working clothing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the storage of the clothing of employees;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for employees to change their clothing; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if so required by the Director, for incubating and testing canned carcasses and poultry products in accordance with paragraphs (9) and (10) of regulation 98.

subsection.content: A sufficient number of containers shall be provided for the temporary storage of soiled linen, overalls, aprons and other items of working clothing.
Clothing shall not be stored in rooms or compartments where carcasses or poultry products are inspected, processed, handled or stored.
Adequate and effective lighting, whether natural or artificial or a combination of both, shall be provided throughout the premises.

All working surfaces in rooms where poultry is slaughtered or carcasses or poultry products are processed or handled shall receive illumination the intensity of which is not less than 320 lux. (L.N. 60 of 1981)
At all parts of the premises used for the inspection of poultry, carcasses or poultry products, the light intensity on working surfaces shall be not less than 540 lux. (L.N. 60 of 1981)
All windows and skylights used for lighting the premises shall, so far as practicable, be kept clean and free from obstruction.
Notwithstanding paragraph (4), any window or skylight may, if necessary, be whitewashed or shaded to mitigate heat or glare.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Ventilation
section.leadIn: All rooms and cubicles in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: poultry is slaughtered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carcasses or poultry products are inspected, processed, handled or stored,

section.continued: shall be effectively ventilated by the circulation of fresh air, so that—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: objectionable odours are eliminated;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: moisture condensation is prevented; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: so far as possible, all particles of feathers, down, hair, dust and other impurities which may be injurious to human health are rendered harmless.

subsection.leadIn: Equipment including equipment used for or in connexion with the—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: slaughter of poultry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: processing of carcasses or poultry products; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: handling of carcasses or poultry products, or of condemned carcasses or poultry products,

subsection.continued: shall be—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: conveniently located and suitable for the purposes for which it is intended to be used; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: so designed, constructed and installed that it can be easily and thoroughly cleaned.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may direct the licensee to remove from the premises any equipment which in the opinion of the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is unsuitable for the purpose for which it is intended to be used; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in an unhygienic condition.

subsection.leadIn: Equipment used for the conveyance, handling or reception of condemned carcasses or condemned poultry products—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be distinctly and conspicuously marked with the Chinese character “不宜食用”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be used for any other purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Scalding vats shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: be so constructed and installed as to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: prevent contamination of pipes used to convey potable water; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: permit water to enter the vats continuously at a rate which will ensure satisfactory and hygienic scalding of poultry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be provided with overflow outlets of sufficient size to enable feathers and water to be readily carried away; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: discharge only into a floor or valley drain or on to the floor in close proximity to such a drain.

subsection.content: Ice shovels shall be smooth surfaced and made of rustproof impervious material.

subsection.leadIn: If poultry is to be wax dipped—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hygienic metal troughs shall be provided to catch any wax from the poultry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: only methods approved by the Director shall be employed in reclaiming the wax for re-use.

subsection.content: Suitable rustproof metal trays, of a design and construction approved by the Director, shall be provided in sufficient numbers to enable each carcass to be eviscerated and kept on an individual tray until post-mortem or further post-mortem inspection is carried out.

subsection.leadIn: The trays shall be so designed and constructed as to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after evisceration, the identity of the viscera with the carcasses from which they have been removed can be maintained; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: blood is not liable to spill from the trays during inspection or normal handling.

subsection.content: If an overhead mechanical conveyor system is used for transporting carcasses or poultry products within the premises it shall be so designed, constructed and maintained that it can be used to convey the carcasses and poultry products together with the trays upon which they may be placed, in a secure and hygienic manner.
Conveyor belts used for moving plucked carcasses and poultry products shall be of non-metallic waterproof material.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Chilling and defrosting tanks
section.leadIn: Chilling and defrosting tanks shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made of metal or other suitable material which is impervious to moisture;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of seamless construction, with the edges rolled outwards; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of such a size that a person may empty the tanks without having to climb inside them.

subsection.content: Such cutting, eviscerating and inspection tables shall be provided at suitable locations in the premises as the Director may require.

subsection.leadIn: All tables used for the inspection or processing of carcasses or poultry products shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made of rustproof metal or such other smooth impermeable material as the Director may approve; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be so constructed that they may be thoroughly and easily cleaned at frequent intervals.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Water spray equipment
section.leadIn: Water spray equipment for washing both inside and the outside surfaces of carcasses, shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: installed in the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of a design and type approved by the Director for installation in the premises; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: so installed and maintained that it has sufficient water pressure at all spray outlets to enable the carcasses to be thoroughly and efficiently washed.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Provision of sterilizing equipment
section.content: Such equipment suitable for sterilizing knives and other equipment shall be provided in the premises as the Director may require.

subsection.content: Watertight containers for the reception of condemned carcasses, condemned poultry products and all viscera and other waste which may result from processing operations shall be provided in the premises at such locations as the Director or an inspector may require.

The containers, and any trolleys used to convey or hold condemned carcasses or condemned poultry products, shall be so constructed of metal, or other material approved by the Director, as to be capable of being thoroughly and easily cleaned by washing.
The containers shall be equipped with means for securely locking or sealing them.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Refrigeration and freezing equipment
section.leadIn: If carcasses or poultry products are to be preserved by freezing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refrigerators; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: freezing plant and equipment,

section.continued: of a type, design, manufacture and capacity approved by the Director for the purpose shall be provided in the premises.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Plucking machinery
section.content: Machinery for plucking or stubbing carcasses, if provided, shall be constructed and installed in such a manner that any accumulations of feathers may be easily removed therefrom.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Restrictions on use of equipment employed in the handling or preparation of substances not for human consumption
section.content: Except with the permission in writing of the Director, equipment used for handling or preparing substances not intended for human consumption shall not be used in any part of the premises where carcasses or poultry products are inspected, processed, handled or stored.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Premises not to be altered without the consent of the Director
section.content: The licensee shall not, except with the approval in writing of the Director, reconstruct, alter, or adapt, or suffer or permit the reconstruction, alteration or adaptation of any premises in respect of which a licence is in force.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Premises
section.leadIn: The licensee shall ensure that premises and the equipment therein are kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free from refuse and other waste; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: so far as is practicable, free from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: loose feathers; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: objectionable odours and conditions.

subsection.content: Poultry batteries and dropping pans shall be cleaned and disinfected regularly with a disinfectant of a type and strength by volume approved by the Director.
All poultry droppings shall be removed from the premises daily.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Scalding vats
section.content: When in use, scalding vats shall be completely emptied and thoroughly cleaned not less frequently than once every day.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Equipment to be cleaned daily
section.content: Equipment used in the slaughter of poultry or in the processing of carcasses or poultry products in a room in which poultry is being slaughtered, plucked or stubbed, shall be thoroughly cleaned at least once each day.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Cleaning of chilling and defrosting tanks
section.leadIn: Tanks used for chilling or defrosting carcasses or poultry products shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be emptied after each occasion in which they are used;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except when the same carcasses or poultry products are held therein for more than twenty-four hours, be thoroughly cleaned at least once each day when in use; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the same carcasses or poultry products are held therein for more than twenty-four hours, be thoroughly cleaned after emptying.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Trays and conveyor belts
section.leadIn: If a carcass or poultry product comes directly into contact with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a tray; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any part of the surface of a conveyor belt,

section.continued: no other carcass or poultry product may be placed thereon until the tray or that part of the conveyor belt has been thoroughly washed.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Equipment to be drained after washing
section.content: After washing, equipment which comes into contact with carcasses or poultry products shall be allowed to drain thoroughly under hygienic conditions, and shall not be stacked.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Clean and hygienic methods to be employed in inspecting, processing, handling and storing carcasses and poultry products
section.content: Clean and hygienic methods shall be used for inspecting, processing, handling and storing carcasses and poultry products, and shall be carried out in such a way that, so far as possible, all carcasses and poultry products remain wholesome and unadulterated.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Carcasses, meat, poultry and animal products not to be brought into poultry export factory
section.content: The licensee shall ensure that no carcass, poultry product, meat or product of any animal, is brought into a poultry export factory.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Storage and handling of substances which may cause objectionable conditions or odours
section.content: Substances which may create objectionable conditions or odours shall not be handled or stored in, or in close proximity to, any room, compartment or other place in the premises where carcasses or poultry products are inspected, processed, handled or stored.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Removal of offal and waste from factory
section.content: All offal and other waste resulting from the evisceration and beheading of carcasses shall be removed from the premises each day, or more often if it is necessary to do so in order to keep the premises in a hygienic state.

subsection.leadIn: The licensee shall ensure that every container in which carcasses or poultry products are packed and all other packing materials are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: clean;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hygienic;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: free from objectionable odours and substances;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of sufficient strength and durability to protect adequately carcasses and poultry products during normal handling, transportation and shipping; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: of a type approved by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Stocks of packing materials shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: kept in a clean dry store until required for use; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: handled in a hygienic manner and as little as possible.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Packing
section.content: The licensee shall ensure that before removal from a poultry export factory, carcasses and poultry products are packed in such a manner that they will be adequately protected during normal handling, storage, shipping or other means of transportation, against contamination by water, insects, rodents, dust, dirt or objectionable or unhygienic bodies or substances.

subsection.leadIn: Material used to line containers in which carcasses or poultry products are packed shall be strong and of such a nature that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it will not tear easily; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it will remain intact if exposed to moisture from carcasses or poultry products.

subsection.content: Unless the carcasses or poultry products are canned or individually wrapped, the containers in which they are packed shall be lined throughout.

subsection.leadIn: The licensee shall provide free of charge to every employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: clean protective clothing of a type approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a cap or other suitable head covering to prevent hair coming into contact with or contaminating the carcasses or poultry products.

subsection.content: The licensee shall, at his own expense, launder the protective clothing, caps and head coverings so provided, as often as may be necessary, to ensure that they are kept clean and in a hygienic state.

subsection.leadIn: Every employee who has been provided with protective clothing, a cap or a head covering under paragraph (1), shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wear it at all times when working in the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: keep it as clean as is consistent with the nature of his work.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use tobacco;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: spit; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: do any other act which is unhygienic, in any part of the premises where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: poultry is slaughtered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: carcasses or poultry products are inspected, processed, handled or stored.

subsection.leadIn: Any employee who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has a septic cut, boil, carbuncle or open sore on his hand or on any exposed part of his body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is suffering from diarrhoea or vomiting;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has a septic discharge from his ears or eyes; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has reason to believe that he may be a carrier of tuberculosis, cholera, typhoid, paratyphoid, dysentery organisms or of a food poisoning or enteric infection,

subsection.continued: shall immediately inform the licensee, and shall refrain from handling—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: poultry, carcasses or poultry products; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: equipment which is likely to come into contact with poultry, carcasses or poultry products.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the permission in writing of a health officer, no licensee shall permit an employee who he knows or has reason to believe may be suffering from any of the conditions or complaints referred to in paragraph (2) to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: handle poultry, carcasses or poultry products, or equipment or packing materials likely to come into contact with poultry, carcasses or poultry products; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be present in any part of the premises where carcasses or poultry products are exposed or handled.

subsection.leadIn: Every employee engaged in handling carcasses or poultry products shall, when so engaged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep his hands, finger nails and all parts of his person which are liable to come into contact with carcasses or poultry products, as clean as is reasonably practicable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: wash his hands thoroughly immediately after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: using the toilet; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: changing his clothing.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Precautions against vermin
section.content: Without prejudice to paragraph (b) of regulation 12 and to regulation 13, the licensee and every employee shall take all practical precautions to exclude flies, rats, mice and other insects and animals from all parts of the premises where carcasses or poultry products are exposed, inspected, processed, handled or stored.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Use of disinfectants and insecticides
section.leadIn: The licensee shall ensure that no person uses any germicide, insecticide, disinfectant, rodenticide, detergent, wetting agent (except pure potable water) or other similar substance in the premises unless the Director has approved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the type, formula and concentration of the substance used; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in which, and the purpose for which, it is used.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Substances and ingredients used in processing carcasses or preparing poultry products
section.leadIn: The licensee shall ensure that no person uses any substances or ingredients in the processing of carcasses or poultry products in a poultry export factory unless such substances or ingredients are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: clean;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wholesome; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: edible.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Inspector to be informed of carcasses or poultry products suspected of being contaminated, unwholesome or adulterated

subsection.leadIn: An employee who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permits a carcass or poultry product in the premises to touch the floor or ground; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reason to believe that a carcass or poultry product in the premises may have touched the floor or ground, or may be contaminated, unwholesome or adulterated,

subsection.continued: shall—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: keep the carcass or poultry product separate so as to maintain its identity;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: immediately report the occurrence or his belief to an inspector; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: when required by the inspector, clearly identify to the inspector the carcass or product in respect of which he has made the report.

subsection.leadIn: The inspector shall carefully inspect every carcass or poultry product in respect of which a report is made under paragraph (1), and shall condemn such carcass or product unless he is satisfied, having regard to all the circumstances and to his inspection, that it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wholesome; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unadulterated.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Vehicles used for conveying carcasses and poultry products

subsection.leadIn: No person shall use, or permit to be used, a vehicle for conveying carcasses or poultry products processed in a poultry export factory, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle is clean and in a hygienic state; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such use of the vehicle has been approved by the Director.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (b) of paragraph (1) shall not apply in respect of the conveyance in a vehicle of carcasses or poultry products which are in hermetically sealed cans.

subsection.leadIn: The Director shall refuse to approve the use of a vehicle for the conveyance of carcasses or poultry products unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the tray or load-carrying part of the vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is provided with a permanently fixed cover; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is equipped with some means, approved by the Director, for protecting and preventing contamination of carcasses and poultry products carried thereon; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle is, in the opinion of the Director, suitable in every respect for the conveyance of carcasses and poultry products.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Inspections to be carried out by inspectors
section.content: All inspections under these regulations shall be carried out by inspectors.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Poultry to be inspected ante mortem

subsection.content: The licensee shall ensure that no poultry is slaughtered in a poultry export factory unless it has first been inspected ante mortem.
Ante-mortem inspection of poultry shall be carried out not more than six hours before slaughter.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Restrictions on entry of poultry to premises and slaughter room

subsection.content: The licensee shall ensure that no person brings live poultry into any part of the premises other than the slaughter room.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall bring—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any live poultry into or permit any live poultry to enter the slaughter room unless such poultry has first undergone ante-mortem inspection and has not been condemned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any carcass into the slaughter room.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Presentation of poultry for ante-mortem inspection
section.leadIn: Poultry shall be presented for ante-mortem inspection in batteries, coops, cages or other containers which shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: constructed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: situated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: lighted,

section.continued: so that the inspector can clearly see and examine the poultry to the extent necessary to carry out a thorough ante-mortem inspection.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Condemnation of poultry on ante-mortem inspection
section.leadIn: On ante-mortem inspection, poultry which is clearly suffering from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any condition which would necessitate condemnation of the carcass on post-mortem examination,

section.name: s71
section.heading: Prohibitions and procedures in respect of poultry condemned on ante-mortem inspection

subsection.leadIn: Poultry condemned on ante-mortem inspection immediately after being so condemned shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be tagged by the inspector as condemned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be disposed of by the licensee in accordance with the conditions attached to the licence.

subsection.content: The licensee shall ensure that no person removes, except with the permission in writing of an inspector, from the premises any poultry condemned on ante-mortem inspection.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Poultry classed as suspect on ante-mortem inspection

subsection.leadIn: Poultry, which on ante-mortem inspection is suspected to be, but is not clearly suffering from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition which might cause the carcass to be condemned on post-mortem examination,

subsection.continued: shall be—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: classed and tagged by the inspector as suspect;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: segregated from the other poultry; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: held for separate slaughter, evisceration and post-mortem inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Poultry so classed as suspect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be slaughtered at a different place or time from poultry which has been passed on ante-mortem inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless on post-mortem inspection it is found to be free from disease, wholesome, unadulterated and fit for human consumption, shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: kept apart from other carcasses and poultry products; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: so handled that there is no risk of it infecting or contaminating other carcasses or poultry products.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Poultry classed as passed on ante-mortem inspection

subsection.leadIn: On ante-mortem inspection, poultry found by an inspector to be free from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any condition, which on post-mortem inspection might cause the carcass to be condemned,

subsection.continued: shall be classed as passed.

subsection.leadIn: Poultry so classed shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: kept segregated from poultry which has not been inspected ante-mortem; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submitted for further ante-mortem inspection if not slaughtered within six hours after undergoing ante- mortem inspection.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Restrictions on feeding poultry before slaughter
section.content: Poultry shall not be slaughtered if it has had access to food or has fed during the twenty-four hours immediately preceding the time of its intended slaughter.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Method of slaughter
section.content: Poultry shall be slaughtered in accordance with good commercial practice in a manner which will result in thorough bleeding of the carcasses and so that breathing stops before scalding.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Place of slaughter
section.content: Poultry which has been classed as passed on ante-mortem inspection shall be slaughtered in the slaughter room and not elsewhere in the premises.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Application of Part VI
section.content: This Part shall not apply in respect of poultry condemned on ante-mortem inspection.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Scalding, plucking and bleeding
section.leadIn: After slaughter, carcasses shall be immediately—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removed from the slaughter room;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: scalded;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: rough plucked; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: thoroughly bled.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Stubbing
section.leadIn: As soon as rough plucking and bleeding has been completed, the carcasses shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removed to a room, not being a room where slaughtering, scalding, rough plucking or bleeding is carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: thoroughly stubbed so that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: protruding pinfeathers are removed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the carcasses have a generally clean appearance, especially on the breast.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), after stubbing and before final washing and chilling, every carcass shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: singed, so that the vestigial feathers, including hair and down, are removed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vented, so that no faeces remain in the cloaca.

subsection.content: Food remaining in the crop shall be removed, but without making any incision.

subsection.leadIn: The head of every carcass shall be thoroughly washed to clean all—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: food from the mouth; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: blood from the head and mouth.

subsection.content: If a carcass is to be warm-eviscerated, it shall not be necessary to comply with paragraph (1) until after evisceration.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Heads, feet and viscera not to be removed until post-mortem inspection
section.content: Subject to the directions of an inspector, the feet, viscera and head of a carcass shall not be removed otherwise than at the time of the post-mortem inspection of the carcass.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Restrictions on removal of carcasses
section.leadIn: The licensee shall ensure that no person removes from the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any carcass unless it has undergone post-mortem inspection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except with the permission in writing of an inspector, any carcass condemned on post-mortem inspection.

subsection.content: Every carcass shall be inspected post mortem.

subsection.leadIn: Post-mortem inspection shall not be carried out in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a slaughter room; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a room where poultry is plucked.

subsection.leadIn: Every carcass shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: presented for post-mortem inspection suspended head downwards or in such other manner as an inspector may require; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: opened so that the internal organs and body cavity are exposed.

subsection.content: Before evisceration, the inspector shall make a preliminary post-mortem inspection of each carcass so presented.

subsection.leadIn: After completion of the preliminary post-mortem inspection the viscera and head shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removed from the carcass;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: put in a separate container; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: kept separate from the viscera and heads of other carcasses until completion of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the post-mortem inspection; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the further post-mortem inspection, in the case of a carcass tagged as suspect under paragraph (1) of regulation 86,

subsection.continued: in such a manner as to preserve their identity with the carcass from which they have been removed.

subsection.content: Post-mortem inspection shall be completed by a thorough examination of the viscera after removal from the carcass.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Condemnation of carcasses on post-mortem inspection

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraphs (2), (3) and (4), upon post-mortem inspection, a carcass found to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adulterated;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: diseased;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: unwholesome;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: badly bruised;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: contaminated by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: volatile oil of any kind;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: poison;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: gas;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: scald water in the air sac system; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a substance which may render the carcass unwholesome;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: overscalded, so that the flesh has a cooked appearance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: affected by any deleterious post-mortem changes; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: greenstruck,

subsection.continued: shall be condemned.

subsection.leadIn: A carcass which upon post-mortem inspection shows evidence of being affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: tuberculosis;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: erythroblastosis, granuloblastosis, neurolymphomatosis gallinorum or other form of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: lymphomatosis;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: myelocystomatosis; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: fowl leukosis;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: septicaemia or other toxaemic disease;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an abnormal physiological state;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a disease characterized by the presence in the flesh of organisms or toxins dangerous to a person who may eat it;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an inflammatory process or systemic disturbance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a tumour; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: parasitic infestation or any lesions of such infestation,

subsection.continued: shall be condemned.

subsection.leadIn: If an inspector is of the opinion that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: poultry has died other than by slaughter in accordance with these regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a carcass is for any reason unfit or unsuitable for human consumption,

subsection.continued: it shall be condemned.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector shall condemn all carcasses and any poultry products which, in his opinion, may have been contaminated by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: flood water; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: polluted water.

subsection.content: No incisions shall be made in a carcass except to the extent necessary for processing and post-mortem inspection.

subsection.leadIn: A carcass shall be incised in such a manner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the skin between the thighs and rib cage will not be cut or torn open during withdrawal of the viscera;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the thigh areas are not opened;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the flesh at the posterior of the keel will not be exposed.

subsection.content: If after conducting the post-mortem inspection, the inspector is uncertain whether or not a carcass ought to be classed as passed, he shall immediately tag it as suspect.

subsection.leadIn: A carcass so tagged shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be removed as soon as possible to a room or compartment provided under regulation 16 for further post-mortem inspection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be retained for further inspection; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: undergo such further post-mortem inspection as an inspector may consider necessary.

subsection.leadIn: Upon further post-mortem inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the inspector is satisfied that the carcass is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: wholesome;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unadulterated; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: edible,

paragraph.continued: the tag shall be removed from the carcass which shall be classed as passed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the inspector is not so satisfied, he shall condemn the carcass.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Carcasses passed on post-mortem inspection
section.leadIn: Subject to regulation 88, on post-mortem inspection, if a carcass is found to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wholesome;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unadulterated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: edible,

section.continued: the inspector shall class it as passed.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Carcasses and poultry products to be subject to additional inspection

subsection.content: Without prejudice to any other regulation, every carcass and every poultry product may be inspected in the premises whenever and as often as an inspector may require.

subsection.leadIn: On an inspection under paragraph (1), if the inspector finds that a carcass or poultry product is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unwholesome;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adulterated; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inedible,

subsection.continued: such carcass or product shall be—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: condemned and tagged by him as condemned;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: placed in a container provided under regulation 40; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: disposed of or treated in accordance with regulation 91.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Procedure in respect of condemned carcasses
section.leadIn: A carcass condemned on post-mortem or further post-mortem inspection shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately after being so condemned, be tagged by the inspector as condemned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be placed, with the viscera thereof, in a container provided under regulation 40;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be removed as soon as is reasonably practicable from the room where the post-mortem or further post-mortem inspection was carried out; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be disposed of or treated in accordance with regulation 91.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Compensation not payable in respect of condemned carcasses or poultry products
section.content: No compensation shall be payable under these regulations in respect of any carcasses or poultry products, condemned by an inspector under these regulations.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Disposal and treatment of condemned carcasses
section.leadIn: The licensee shall ensure that every carcass and every poultry product condemned on inspection under these regulations are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disposed of by thorough incineration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: treated with a liberal application of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: crude carbolic acid;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: kerosene;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: diesel oil;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: used sump oil; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: such other substance as may be approved for the purpose by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Immediately after post-mortem or further post-mortem inspection, every carcass classed as passed shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subjected to a final thorough washing by passing it through a system of sprays delivering an abundant supply of fresh potable water either under pressure or with a scrubing action;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: drained; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: chilled in accordance with a hygienic method of chilling approved by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The internal body temperature of every carcass shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be reduced during the initial period of chilling to not higher than 5oC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (3), be maintained after the initial period of chilling at not higher than 5oC—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: until the process of preserving the carcass in accordance with Part VII is commenced; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the carcass is to be used in the preparation of a poultry product, until the carcass is used in the preparation of such product.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subparagraph (b) of paragraph (2), after the initial period of chilling and before the process of preserving the chilled carcass in accordance with Part VII is commenced, subject to paragraph (4), during packing or further processing of the carcass, the internal body temperature thereof may be allowed to rise to not higher than 13oC.

subsection.leadIn: If during—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: further processing or packing the internal body temperature of the carcass; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: preparation of a poultry product the internal temperature thereof, (L.N. 336 of 1990)

subsection.continued: has been allowed to rise above 5oC the carcass or poultry product, as the case may be, shall immediately after such further processing, packing or preparation be refrigerated so that the internal body temperature of the carcass or the internal temperature of the poultry product is promptly lowered to 5oC or below.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (4) shall not apply in the case of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a carcass which is to be preserved in accordance with Part VII immediately after it has been further processed or packed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a poultry product which is to be preserved in accordance with Part VII immediately after it has been prepared.

subsection.leadIn: The initial period of chilling referred to in paragraph (2) shall not last longer than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: four hours in the case of a carcass the weight of which does not exceed 2 kilograms; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: six hours in the case of a carcass which exceeds 2 kilograms.

subsection.content: The weights mentioned in paragraph (6) are of carcasses following post-mortem inspection and after removal of their heads and viscera.

subsection.def: In this regulation, initial period of chilling (冷凍初期) means the time which elapses between commencing to chill a carcass and the reduction of the internal body temperature of the carcass to 5oC.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Restrictions on the use of additives

subsection.leadIn: Subject to these regulations, the licensee shall ensure that no substance is, except with the approval of the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: added to; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: used in the processing of,

subsection.continued: carcasses or poultry products.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), common salt (NaCl) may be used—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in aqueous solution in a concentration not exceeding 7 kilograms of salt to 10 000 litres of water, as a chilling agent; and (L.N. 60 of 1981)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to salt carcasses and poultry products which are to be preserved by drying in accordance with regulation 99.

subsection.content: No approval shall be given under paragraph (1), unless the Director is satisfied that, having regard to the conditions and manner of its intended use, the substance will not cause carcasses or poultry products to become adulterated, unwholesome or inedible.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Disposal of viscera
section.leadIn: After a carcass has been classed as passed on post-mortem or further post-mortem inspection, the viscera shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: placed in a watertight metal container; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: removed from the premises as soon as practicable, and in any event within not more than twelve hours after being so classed.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Carcasses and poultry products to be preserved

subsection.leadIn: Every carcass and every poultry product shall be preserved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: freezing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: canning;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: drying;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: pickling; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: smoking,

subsection.continued: in accordance with these regulations using such hygienic processes as may be approved by the Director.

subsection.content: Preservation of carcasses and poultry products under these regulations shall only be carried out indoors in a poultry export factory.

subsection.leadIn: At the commencement of the process of preserving a carcass by any of the methods referred to in paragraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the water content of a carcass shall not exceed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a turkey carcass, four and half per cent of the weight of such carcass; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a duck or other poultry carcass, six per cent of the weight of such carcass;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the water content of a poultry product shall not exceed six per cent of the weight of such poultry product.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Period within which the process of preserving is to be commenced and completed

subsection.leadIn: The process of preserving a carcass or poultry product by any of the methods referred to in paragraph (1) of regulation 95 shall be commenced—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a carcass, not later than twenty-four hours after slaughter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a poultry product, not less than twenty-four hours after the slaughter of the poultry used in the preparation of such poultry product.

subsection.leadIn: The process of preserving by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: freezing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: canning,

subsection.continued: shall be completed not later than seventy-two hours after—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the carcass; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of a poultry product, any carcass used in the preparation thereof,

subsection.continued: has undergone post-mortem inspection carried out at the time of evisceration.

subsection.leadIn: The process of preserving by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pickling;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: drying; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: smoking,

subsection.continued: shall be completed not later than one hundred and forty-four hours after—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the carcass; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of a poultry product, any carcass used in the preparation thereof,

subsection.continued: has undergone post-mortem inspection carried out at the time of evisceration.

subsection.leadIn: If the licensee fails to comply with paragraph (1), (2) or (3), he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the failure to an inspector as soon as possible; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce to the inspector every carcass and every poultry product in respect of which the failure has occurred.

subsection.content: Carcasses and poultry products produced to an inspector under subparagraph (b) of paragraph (4) shall be condemned by the inspector.

subsection.leadIn: The process of preserving a carcass or poultry product by freezing shall be carried out in such a way that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the internal body temperature of the carcass; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a poultry product, the internal temperature at the middle of the product,

subsection.continued: is reduced to not higher than -18oC within sixty hours after the freezing process is commenced. (L.N. 60 of 1981)

subsection.content: The licensee shall ensure that after completion of the freezing process, frozen carcasses and poultry products, so long as they remain in the premises, are kept under such conditions that they remain in a totally frozen state.

subsection.leadIn: Any can used for canning a carcass or poultry product shall—

paragraph.name: a
