paragraph.content: be of a material, design, manufacture and size approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately prior to filling, be thoroughly washed.

subsection.content: Each can shall be washed while the can is held in an inverted position, with water having a temperature of not less than 82oC. (L.N. 60 of 1981)

subsection.leadIn: Each can when filled with a carcass or poultry product shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately closed and hermetically sealed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carefully examined to ascertain whether it has been properly sealed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: heat processed in accordance with paragraph (5).

subsection.leadIn: Before heat processing, each batch or lot of cans shall be tagged or marked in such manner as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: will clearly indicate any failure of the heat process.

subsection.content: Heat processing shall be carried out at such temperatures and for such periods of time as the Director may require.
As soon as possible after completion of heat processing, the cans shall be further examined to ensure that they are perfectly sealed.

subsection.leadIn: Following the elapse of not less than six hours after heat processing, cans which, in the opinion of an inspector, show signs of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been overstuffed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shortage of vacuum,

subsection.continued: shall be marked by such inspector as condemned and disposed of together with their contents by incineration.

subsection.content: If on examination under paragraph (3) or (6), a can is found to be improperly or imperfectly sealed, the carcass or poultry product therein shall be promptly removed and recanned in a different can.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: detain for incubation any canned carcass or canned poultry product; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out such tests, to determine the wholesomeness of the carcasses and poultry products so detained as he thinks fit.

subsection.content: A carcass or poultry product so detained shall, before testing, be incubated for not less than ten days, or such longer period as an inspector may require, at a temperature of not less than 35oC and not more than 38oC. (L.N. 60 of 1981)

subsection.leadIn: Carcasses and poultry products which are to be preserved by drying shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be thoroughly salted in a hygienic manner approved by the Director, and washed with fresh, potable water;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after salting and washing, be suspended in a drying chamber of a design and construction approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remain continuously in the drying chamber for not less than ninety-six hours with the temperature in the chamber maintained throughout at not lower than 50oC and not higher than 65oC. (L.N. 60 of 1981)

subsection.leadIn: After drying, the carcasses or poultry products shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be thoroughly soaked in clean peanut oil; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if they are to be canned after drying, canned in peanut oil in accordance with regulation 98.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Preservation by pickling or salting
section.content: The process of preserving carcasses or poultry products by pickling or salting shall be carried out in a hygienic manner approved by the Director.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Inspectors not to have financial interest in poultry
section.leadIn: No inspector shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: perform any duties or exercise any powers under these regulations in respect of poultry, carcasses or poultry products in which he is directly or indirectly financially interested; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except with the permission in writing of the Director, accept any payment, reward or gift from a licensee.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Licensee to pay for inspection service
section.content: Upon demand the licensee shall pay to the Director, in respect of inspections carried out under these regulations, the fees specified in the Third Schedule.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Inspector to report contraventions to the Director
section.content: An inspector, upon becoming aware of any contravention of these regulations, shall, as soon as practicable, report such contravention to the Director.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Inspector may prohibit use of equipment, rooms or compartments contravening these regulations

subsection.leadIn: If an inspector is of the opinion that any equipment, room or compartment in a poultry export factory is unclean, in an unhygienic state or otherwise contravenes these regulations, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice in writing to the licensee of his opinion and may by such notice prohibit the use of the equipment, room or compartment until further notice has been given to the licensee under paragraph (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as reasonably practicable deliver to the Director a copy of the notice so given.

subsection.content: An inspector may at any time withdraw a prohibition under a notice given under paragraph (1) upon being satisfied that the equipment, room or compartment to which the notice relates is clean, in a hygienic state and otherwise complies with these regulations, by giving notice in writing to the licensee of the withdrawal of the prohibition.

The licensee shall ensure that no person uses in the premises any equipment, room or compartment in respect of which notice prohibiting such use has been given to the licensee under subparagraph (a) of paragraph (1) until the prohibition has been withdrawn by notice given to the licensee under paragraph (2).
The Director shall devise and provide a means of reproducing distinctive inspection marks for use by inspectors in a poultry export factory.

subsection.leadIn: An inspection mark—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall be applied or affixed in the premises, either directly or by means of a label, to every—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: wrapper;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: can; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: container,

paragraph.continued: containing a carcass or poultry product;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall not be so applied or affixed to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a can, until after it has been hermetically sealed, inspected and passed in accordance with Part VII; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a shipping container used to transport carcasses or poultry products until the carcasses or poultry products to be packed therein have been so packed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: shall clearly indicate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that every carcass or poultry product contained in the wrapper, can or container bearing the inspection mark has been inspected and passed under these regulations;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the identity of the inspector who applied or affixed the mark;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the identity and licence number of the poultry export factory in which such carcass or poultry product was preserved or prepared; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the date when the mark was so applied or affixed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall be applied or affixed only by an inspector; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: shall be printed or stencilled on the shipping container and shall not be applied or affixed to such a container by means of a rubber stamp.

subsection.content: An inspector shall not apply or affix an inspection mark to any wrapper, can or container, unless at the time of applying or affixing such mark he is satisfied that every carcass or poultry product within the wrapper, can or container is unadulterated, wholesome and edible.

Every inspection mark devised and provided by the Director under paragraph (1), shall include the following—“Inspected for wholesomeness by the Hong Kong Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department.”. (L.N. 331 of 1999)

section.name: s106
section.heading: Labels and marks not to be applied directly to carcass or poultry product
section.content: No label or mark shall be applied or affixed directly to a carcass or poultry product.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector shall use tags of a design and colour approved by the Director for the identification and control of poultry, carcasses or poultry products which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been condemned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are held for further inspection as suspects.

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (1), an inspector may use such tags, seals or other devices and methods as may be approved by the Director to identify and control the use of equipment, rooms or compartments in a poultry export factory found to be unclean, unhygienic or otherwise to contravene these regulations.

subsection.leadIn: No person, other than an inspector, shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: tamper with; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove,

subsection.continued: a tag, seal or other device used by an inspector in accordance with paragraph (1) or (2).

subsection.content: Every wrapper, can or container in which there is a carcass or poultry product shall, at the time of removal from the poultry export factory, bear an appropriate label, the design, form and use of which has been approved by the Director.
No person shall use a label other than for a purpose for which the use thereof has been approved by the Director under paragraph (1).

subsection.leadIn: The label shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be durable, and clearly printed in block capital letters and figures, or in easily legible characters; (65 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securely affixed to the wrapper, can or container;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: unless the Director otherwise authorizes be in the English language or the Chinese language; (65 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature and the common name or usual description of the carcass or poultry product;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the ingredients, if any, and the proportions thereof, added to, or used in the processing of the carcass or poultry product;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the net weight of the carcass or poultry product; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: bear an inspection mark applied under regulation 105.

subsection.content: In the case of a carcass or poultry product which is individually wrapped or packed, the net weight of such carcass or product may include the weight of the individual wrapper or container not exceeding 10 grams. (L.N. 60 of 1981)

Without prejudice to paragraph (1), every can containing a carcass or poultry product shall, immediately after canning, be permanently marked in such manner as the Director may approve, so as to indicate clearly the precise nature of the contents of the can and the date of canning.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Specimens of inspection marks and labels be sent to appropriate authorities for information
section.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send to the appropriate authorities samples or specimens of any marks or labels devised, provided, approved or authorized by him under these regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before devising, providing, approving or authorizing any mark or label, consult with the appropriate authorities concerning the design, colour, wording, language and use thereof.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this regulation, an inspector who has been authorized in writing by the Director for the purpose may, upon request, issue an export certificate in such form as may be approved by the Director, in respect of carcasses or poultry products which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are intended to be exported to any of the countries specified in the First Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been slaughtered, processed, inspected, and passed in accordance with these regulations.

subsection.content: No inspector shall issue an export certificate unless he has first inspected the carcasses or poultry products to which such certificate relates to ascertain whether they have been so slaughtered, processed, inspected and passed.

subsection.leadIn: Every export certificate shall bear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the signature of the inspector issuing it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of its issue;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the names of the exporter and of the consignee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the destination of the carcasses or poultry products in respect of which the certificate is issued;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the shipping marks;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the total net weight and a full description of the carcasses or poultry products in respect of which the certificate is issued; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: such other information as the Director may require.

subsection.content: The original and a duplicate copy of every export certificate shall be delivered by the inspector to the person who requested the issue thereof.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct a person to whom an export certificate has been issued or who is in possession of an export certificate to surrender the certificate to him; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel an export certificate issued under this regulation. (L.N. 336 of 1990)

subsection.leadIn: As soon as reasonably practicable after the cancellation of an export certificate, the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause the person to whom the certificate was issued to be served, either personally or by registered post, with a notice in writing informing him of such cancellation and of the reasons therefor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inform the appropriate authority in the country to which the carcasses or poultry products referred to in the cancelled certificate were to be exported of such cancellation and of the reasons therefor.

subsection.content: Failure to comply with paragraph (6) shall not affect the validity of the cancellation by the Director of an export certificate.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Director to give information to appropriate authorities upon grant of licence to use premises as a poultry export factory
section.leadIn: As soon as possible after the grant of a licence the Director shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the appropriate authorities in every country specified in the First Schedule of such grant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: forward to the appropriate authorities such information concerning—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licensee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the location, design and construction of the premises and of the equipment therein; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: other relevant matters,

paragraph.continued: as the Director may consider appropriate or necessary.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Records
section.leadIn: A licensee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep such records relating to his poultry export factory and the operation thereof in such form and manner as the Director may require;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit the Director, a public officer authorized by the Director for the purpose or any inspector, to inspect the records at all reasonable times; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: deliver to the Director, at such times as he may require, the records, or such summaries of, or extracts from them, as he may direct.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Director may vary or rescind decisions of inspectors

subsection.content: The Director may, in his absolute discretion, vary or rescind any decision of an inspector under these regulations.
A decision of the Director under this regulation shall have the same force and effect as if it was a decision of an inspector under these regulations.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Person aggrieved to have a right of appeal

subsection.leadIn: Except where an appeal lies under paragraph (2), any person aggrieved by a decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (3) of an inspector,

subsection.continued: may appeal to the Chief Executive against such decision and on consideration of such appeal the Chief Executive may make such order as he thinks just.

subsection.leadIn: A person aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the refusal of the Director to grant a licence under these regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revocation of such a licence by the Director,

subsection.continued: may appeal by way of petition to the Chief Executive in Council against the refusal or revocation.

subsection.content: No appeal shall lie under paragraph (1) in respect of any decision of an inspector, unless the person aggrieved has, before appealing to the Chief Executive, informed the Director in writing that he objects to the decision of the inspector.

section.name: s115
section.heading: Liability for nuisance not affected
section.leadIn: Nothing in these regulations or in a licence granted under them shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorize the commission of a nuisance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affect the liability of any person in respect of a nuisance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: restrict or remove the right or power of any person to abate a nuisance.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Manner of signifying approval of Director
section.leadIn: The Director shall signify any approval, authorization or consent given by him under these regulations either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally, by notice in the Gazette, or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any particular case, in writing.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes any of the provisions specified in Part I of the Fourth Schedule shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
A person who contravenes any of the provisions specified in Part II of the Fourth Schedule shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
A person who contravenes any of the provisions specified in Part III of the Fourth Schedule shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

A person who wilfully fails to comply with any direction of the Director under subparagraph (a) of paragraph (5) of regulation 110 shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

If a person by whom an offence under these regulations is committed is a corporation, every director or other officer concerned in the management of the corporation shall be guilty of the like offence unless he proves that the offence was committed without his consent or connivance and that he exercised all such due diligence to prevent the commission of the offence as he ought to have exercised having regard to the nature of his functions in that capacity and to all the circumstances.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Commencement of prosecutions
section.content: Prosecutions for offences under these regulations shall not be commenced without the consent in writing of the Director.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Power of Director to give directions to licensee
section.content: The Director may give the licensee such directions as he thinks fit for the purposes of these regulations.

section.name: s120
section.heading: Requirements of these regulations to be additional to and not in derogation of other enactments
section.leadIn: Except where the context otherwise requires, the requirements of these regulations shall be additional to, and not in derogation of, the requirements of—
